question: Question_02_(d)
sols:
First, \emph{rank(A)} is the number of pivot columns in \emph{A} (or
\emph{rref(A)}), which is 3.

From the Rank-nullity theorem, since \emph{A\textsuperscript{T}} is a
\emph{5×4} matrix: \emph{dim(N(A\textsuperscript{T})) = 4 -
rank(A\textsuperscript{T})}. Since the rank of \emph{A} equals the rank
of \emph{A\textsuperscript{T}} we obtain
\emph{dim(N(A\textsuperscript{T})) = 4 - 3 = 1}.
hints:
The rank of \emph{A} is the number of pivot columns in \emph{rref(A)}.

Further, by the Rank-nullity theorem, for a \emph{m×n} matrix \emph{A}
it holds that \emph{rank(A) + dim(N(A)) = n}. What does that imply for
\emph{A\textsuperscript{T}}?
